channel.title: How to install Black Mesa
channel.description:
I've seen numerous recipes to try and install Black Mesa (I had to search too since it wasn't working). Here's what did the job for me, where other recipes didn't.
1) Launch Steam and install, in Library/Tools, "Source SDK Base 2007". This takes a little less than 4 GB on the disk.
2) Download the [i]BlackMesa.7z[/i] file.
You can download the installer as well and try to run it but here it failed, probably because Steam has changed (I'm not sure this project is still on), and also because it wasn't uncompressing the .7z archive. So in this case you can simply follow the next steps.
3) Uncompress it into [i]<Steam directory>\SteamApps\sourcemods\BMS[/i], so it looks like this:
<Steam directory>\SteamApps\sourcemods\BMS\BlackMesa\bin\ <Steam directory>\SteamApps\sourcemods\BMS\BlackMesa\cfg\ ...
4) Create a shortcut.
For example, if your Steam directory is [i]D:\games\Steam[/i], the shortcut target should be:
[i]D:\games\Steam\Steam.exe -applaunch 218 -game "d:\games\Steam\SteamApps\sourcemods\BMS\BlackMesa"[/i]
You don't need to see it in the Steam library, I doubt that these days it's still possible to make it appear there anyway.
5) Launch the game from the shortcut.
HTH. Have fun!

item.title: How to install Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
Assuming you downloaded the mod correctly, you should have:

BlackMesa.7z
BlackMesa.md5
BlackMesa-Setup.exe

BlackMesa-Setup is all you need to touch, as it automatically decompresses the .7z into the right directory.

item.title: How to install Black Mesa
item.dc:creator: Redglyph
item.description:
CatzEyes93:

Which is pretty much what the wiki directions say eh?

Not really, no. If it were the case, it’d been much easier and I wouldn’t post this

  1. Install Black Mesa
    Click the file blackmesa-setup.exe to start the installation process. Be sure the game is installed to this directory: \Steam\steamapps\sourcemods\BMS
  2. Launch Steam and find the game “Black Mesa” listed in your game’s “Library”

As I said, the setup only puts a .7z and it has to be decompressed manually (maybe it depends on where one downloads it). And Black Mesa isn’t listed in the Library, or at least not for many people.
